title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:17 <arkub> has quit  
00:40 <jstoldt> i bet i just made enemies for writing such a novel on the mailing list... :-D  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> I've seen longer  
00:42 <+cjdelisle> looks like good information  
00:43 <+cjdelisle> the path to an xwiki installation is important to understand so we can make it easy to follow.  
00:46 <+cjdelisle> "do not replace a proper installation of a database and"  
00:46 <+cjdelisle> servlet container.  
00:47 <+cjdelisle> What operating system, database, servlet setup do you invision?  
00:47 <jstoldt> well, i didn't mention but i was working on windows  
00:48 <jstoldt> dunno about how bad it is on \*nix  
00:48 <jstoldt> but on windows i tried a fair bit to get a working environment  
00:49 <jstoldt> and i needed to edit a couple of files  
00:49 <+cjdelisle> It's pretty easy to use on \*nix because most devs use it and because \*nix is made for servers.  
00:50 <jstoldt> so what i'd actually like would be a configuration dialog on install that prompts the user for the most important settings, i.e. MaxPermSize, initial Pool Size, max pool size, port, compression and so forth  
00:50 <jstoldt> and then it's just do the install...  
00:51 <jstoldt> anyway, i think the update bit is even more important than the install  
00:51 <jstoldt> because once installed properly there is little to worry in that regard  
00:51 <jstoldt> it would just lower the bar for installing  
00:51 <jstoldt> (on win)  
00:52 <+cjdelisle> I have thought it would be nice to have a "wizard" to wal the user through installation and generate configuation files.  
00:52 <+cjdelisle> +k +r  
00:52 <jstoldt> exactly  
00:52 <jstoldt> that's exactly what i had in mind  
00:53 <+cjdelisle> What I wanted to so was let the user download a config file in their browser and leave it to them to put it in /etc/ or somewhere safe.  
00:53 <+cjdelisle> (on the server)  
00:53 <jstoldt> well, might be better from a rights management POV on \*nix, i reckon  
00:54 <+cjdelisle> But the problem with that idea is we have 3 configuration files, nobody really wants to combine them, and having the user put a config.zip file in etc is a horror.  
00:55 <jstoldt> right, although including the servlet container you'd even have 4...  
00:56 <jstoldt> but you could make an executable that needs to be started with root rights that will just alter the existing files accordingly  
00:56 <jstoldt> a little like what I did in the batch script i gave my former colleagues  
00:57 <+cjdelisle> Programs which need to start as root are an eyesore IMO  
00:57 <jstoldt> but with an interactive wizard like GUI  
00:57 <jstoldt> well, you are right about that but i reckon the root rights will be necessary to change, say, tomcats configs, huh?  
00:58 <+cjdelisle> yes. Editing most anything in /etc/ requires you to be root.  
00:58 <jstoldt> thought so...  
00:59 <cjdelisle> is now known as <rooted>  
00:59 <jstoldt> hrhrhrhr  
00:59 <jstoldt> well, i'll be going to sweet slumber now... got trouble keeping my eyes open, already  
00:59 <jstoldt> good night, see you tomorrow  
01:00 <+rooted> k. I think we really need that wizard thing.  
01:00 <+rooted> gotta figure out how to avoid making all the security people mad by requiring xwiki to have uid0  
01:01 <rooted> is now known as <cjdelisle>  
01:01 <+cjdelisle> nickserv is like "yur gunna get ghosted..."

09:10 <+sburjan> hello. I am testing latest build, but when I want to put a status I get a velo error  
09:10 <+sburjan> on the AS  
09:20 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <vmassol> good morning  
09:39 <vmassol> myxwiki.org is really in a bad shape  
09:39 <vmassol> restarting 10 times per day  
09:40 <vmassol> and not answering right now  
09:40 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning, any recent luck in the release? Can I help somehow?  
09:44 <vmassol> checking hudson  
09:44 <vmassol> I see platform/web is not building, I can fix this one  
09:45 <vmassol> it's because the pom is using 40-SNAPSHOT  
09:45 <vmassol> fixing  
09:45 <+mflorea> vmassol: no luck. works with -DdryRun but fails when run for real. It fails also with the previous version of maven release plugin. Ths issue is this http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-657  
09:46 <+mflorea> vmassol: 40-SNAPSHOT is fine because I haven't released web yet  
09:46 <vmassol> no 40-SNAPSHOT is not working  
09:46 <vmassol> at least on hudson  
09:46 <vmassol> because of the license generation issue  
09:47 <+mflorea> yes, but it's not a "bug" if I had released it then I would have increased the version  
09:47 <vmassol> right but let's keep hudson working  
09:47 <+mflorea> ok  
09:47 <vmassol> right = if the build works for you locally  
09:47 <vmassol> (although it may introduce a small bug in that the license may not be in the release distribution)  
09:47 <vmassol> s/release/released/  
09:48 <vmassol> (but that's acceptable)  
09:48 <vmassol> re http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-657 do we know what's different from before?  
09:48 <vmassol> maybe for the release we could not use this property?  
09:49 <vmassol> maybe using http://mojo.codehaus.org/versions-maven-plugin/ would help  
09:49 <+mflorea> how?  
09:49 <vmassol> don't know  
09:49 <vmassol> :)  
09:50 <vmassol> I know it has goals for updating properties that's all  
09:50 <vmassol> reading http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-657  
09:50 <vmassol> (to try to understand ità  
09:50 <vmassol> )  
09:51 <vmassol> ah  
09:51 <vmassol> did you try replacing ${project.version} for <commons.version> with the value?  
09:51 <vmassol> that's what we do when we release  
09:51 <+mflorea> it's annoying because I can't reproduce it without actually affecting the scm  
09:51 <vmassol> is that the problem?  
09:52 <vmassol> last time I released  
09:52 <vmassol> I had to change references to ${project.version} with a hardcoded version  
09:52 <vmassol> do the release  
09:52 <+mflorea> :) sure, I did this from the start, <commons.version>3.0-milestone-3<commons.version>  
09:52 <vmassol> then set back ${project.version} after  
09:52 <vmassol> ok  
09:52 <vmassol> because http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-657 seems to be that  
09:52 <vmassol> so it's different  
09:53 <+mflorea> there is also http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-217  
09:56 <vmassol> which maven version are you using btw?  
09:57 <+mflorea> 2.2.1, I'm releasing from hudson agent machine  
09:57 <vmassol> have you tried using 3.0.3?  
09:57 <vmassol> you can do the release locally  
09:58 <+mflorea> I haven't. I'll try  
10:04 <+sburjan> I get a velocity error when I try to put something on my status (latest build)  
10:04 <vmassol> sburjan: normal you don't have the right web probably  
10:04 <vmassol> myxwiki.org dead again  
10:04 <+sburjan> I downloaded the snapshot from maven  
10:04 <vmassol> it worked for a few seconds  
10:04 <vmassol> sburjan: and?  
10:05 <vmassol> it's not because it's on maven.xwiki.org that it's working :)  
10:05 <+sburjan> so I didn't imported packages manually or something :)  
10:05 <vmassol> if you check hudson you'lls ee that the web module is fialing  
10:05 <vmassol> btw I don't understand why hudson builds enterprise if the web module is failing  
10:05 <+sburjan> but if the web module is failing, shouldn't the whole build fail ?  
10:05 <+sburjan> exactly :)  
10:05 <vmassol> whole build no  
10:05 <vmassol> definitelt not  
10:06 <vmassol> but modules depending on it yes  
10:06 <+sburjan> well if one module isn't build, isn't the whole process stopped and e-mail notifs sent ?  
10:06 <vmassol> no  
10:06 <vmassol> only modules depending on it  
10:06 <+sburjan> I see  
10:07 <+sburjan> I'm curious then about packaging, if  there is one module which failed, how will it be included in the final package from maven  
10:09 <vmassol> why would you want it to be included?  
10:10 <vmassol> maybe you missed my message above: "btw I don't understand why hudson builds enterprise if the web module is failing"  
10:10 <vmassol> hmm  
10:10 <vmassol> are you sure enterprise was built?  
10:11 <vmassol> I see on hudson that last time it was built was: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Enterprise/job/xwiki-product-enterprise/6988/  
10:11 <vmassol> see http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Enterprise/job/xwiki-product-enterprise/  
10:11 <vmassol> let me check web  
10:12 <vmassol> yeah it's failing since the 7th so enteprrise shouldn't have been built  
10:12 <vmassol> probably a hudson bug  
10:12 <vmassol> we haven't updated it in a long time  
10:12 <vmassol> I'm keen to update it to the latest jenkins version, I'll probably do this today  
10:14 <vmassol> sburjan: fyi next web build should be fine  
10:14 <vmassol> 5mn remaining  
10:15 <+sburjan> okay. I am not able tot test much on the current snapshot.. nothing from what sergiu committed works  
10:15 <vmassol> it does  
10:15 <+sburjan> maybe because web wasn't properly built  
10:15 <vmassol> I tested it  
10:15 <vmassol> but you need to build from sources  
10:15 <+sburjan> :)  
10:15 <+sburjan> I am running the zip from maven  
10:16 <+sburjan> re http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-770. I don't even have the Share written on that button  
10:17 <+sburjan> i have xe.activity.messages.submit  
10:17 <+sburjan> :)  
10:17 <+sburjan> gonna wait for the new build on maven  
10:20 <+sburjan> vmassol: about the Automated Test Plan I have to do .. I have to gather some data from clover. So when you have time we should have a talk about the plan, because I am missing a lot of details on what should contain the manual test plan  
10:20 <+sburjan> \*the automated test plan  
10:21 <vmassol> sburjan: enterprise will be built in 11 minutes  
10:21 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <vmassol> you'll be able to test with that release  
10:22 <+sburjan> cool .. I'm curious on the new features  
10:22 <+sburjan> yes  
10:22 <vmassol> then I'll move to jenkins  
10:23 <+sburjan> I will send an e-mail to devs about the new Manual Testing Strategy. On what we discussed with Ludovic ... a final release will be tested pre and post release, both of them having a MTR  
10:24 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <+sburjan> Search Suggest feature is very cool  
10:25 <vmassol> yes it would be cool if it worked :)  
10:25 <vmassol> I haven't tested jvelociter's last changes  
10:25 <vmassol> jvelociter: btw we need a shortcut key to put focus in the search box  
10:25 <+sburjan> I see if i write Admin, id doesn't show up with nothing on Users. The other users created show up when I type their names  
10:26 <vmassol> if I type "home" it doesn't show any WebHome page  
10:26 <vmassol> so for me it's not working  
10:27 <+sburjan> true. I also get 2 js errors :P  
10:28 <vmassol> jvelociter: another bug: type a few chars, then hit delete several times to remove them all and have an empty field content, it's spinning forever for me  
10:28 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol> hmm can't reproduce it  
10:28 <+jvelociter> vmassol: re Home vs WebHome that's a lucene bug, the one referenced by thomas last time  
10:28 <+sburjan> will we have also a RC2 for 3.0 ?  
10:28 <vmassol> question for sergiu: how do I remove a message? :)  
10:29 <+jvelociter> yes we need a shortcut  
10:29 <vmassol> sburjan: RC2 is only if needed, it's a failure to have a good RC1  
10:29 <+jvelociter> vmassol: c.f. http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=home&x=0&y=0  
10:29 <+jvelociter> does not bring any home page  
10:30 <+jvelociter> s/home/WebHome/  
10:30 <+jvelociter> thansk for reporting any bug in JIRA in any case, this would help  
10:30 <+jvelociter> like the JS errors for example  
10:31 <+sburjan> vmassol: wdym to be a failure to have a good RC1 ?  
10:31 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: regarding the thread with moving the webmodules to org.xwiki instead of com.xpn ... did we reach a consensus ?  
10:35 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: i tough you were using lucene syntax to match more  
10:37 <+tmortagne> you should match anything using \*  
10:39 <+tmortagne> ha yoou can't use it before the word in lucene syntax  
10:40 <+tmortagne> so that would not work for home and webhome  
10:47 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: yep  
10:47 <+jvelociter> I postfix with \*  
10:47 <+jvelociter> but you can't prefix  
10:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: downloaded t he build... Now everything seems much better  
10:59 <vmassol> starting jenkins upgrade  
10:59 <vmassol> sburjan: re webmodule yes we reached a consensus, I just need to do it, was waiting for the 3.0M3 release first  
10:59 <+sburjan> so hudson will be down ?  
11:00 <vmassol> for a few seconds yes  
11:00 <+sburjan> vmassol: I read the thread. but in the final, will you move all as Ludo wanted, or not all of them ?  
11:01 <vmassol> just web for now till we finish that conversation  
11:01 <+sburjan> ok  
11:04 <vmassol> uprgade done, jenkins restarting  
11:05 <vmassol> mflorea: did it work? (crossing fingers)  
11:06 <+mflorea> vmassol: same.. here's the last part of the console log http://pastebin.com/uGPQTwDc  
11:07 <vmassol> jenkins is now operational :)  
11:07 <+tmortagne> they could have changed the logo or something :)  
11:07 <+sburjan> URL ? :)  
11:08 <vmassol> hudson.xwiki.org  
11:08 <+sburjan> oh, still hudson  
11:08 <vmassol> no jenkins  
11:08 <vmassol> :)  
11:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: why would they? it's their logo ;)  
11:08 <+sburjan> lol,almost same interface if not exactly the same :D we'll have to create DNS aliases for ci.xwiki.org and jenkins.xwiki.org, right ? :)  
11:08 <+mflorea> vmassol: and this is the debug log http://pastebin.com/xv8y0A8P  
11:09 <+tmortagne> yea well they changed their name ;)  
11:09 <vmassol> ah the name wasn"t theirs  
11:09 <vmassol> (trademark)  
11:10 <vmassol> mflorea: :(  
11:10 <+tmortagne> yea I know but since the name is not the same thay could have change a little something graphically  
11:18 <vmassol> guys I think I've found a blocker: XWIKI-6086  
11:19 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <+jvelociter> vmassol: are you sure it used to work ?  
11:21 <vmassol> yep never had an issue with it  
11:22 <vmassol> but I just commented o nthe issue  
11:22 <vmassol> I stopped and restarted my instance and it's working again  
11:22 <vmassol> something seems to be breaking it… but I don't know what  
11:22 <+jvelociter> hmm  
11:22 <+jvelociter> I will check it's not the search suggest  
11:22 <vmassol> wairt  
11:22 <vmassol> checking something  
11:23 <vmassol> yes I know  
11:23 <vmassol> commenting on the issue  
11:23 <vmassol> it doesn't work if I'm not an admin user  
11:23 <+jvelociter> that's because XWiki space would be blacklisted  
11:24 <+jvelociter> ?  
11:24 <+jvelociter> BTW I still haven't added blacklisted spaces filter on search suggest, but I plan to do it  
11:24 <vmassol> hmmm ok....  
11:24 <vmassol> sp you cannot navigate to other users easily  
11:24 <vmassol> (when you're a simple user)  
11:24 <vmassol> setting my user as advanced to check  
11:25 <+jvelociter> yes that's a problem  
11:25 <vmassol> jvelociter: doesn't work as advanced  
11:25 <vmassol> advanced user  
11:25 <vmassol> but I can see the xwiki space on the home page  
11:27 <vmassol> jvelociter: could the blacklist be hardcoded for the goto page feature?  
11:27 <vmassol> checking code  
11:27 <vmassol> not sure where it's located  
11:27 <+jvelociter> vmassol: might be that advanced user is not checked  
11:27 <vmassol> yes maybe  
11:27 <+jvelociter> it's jumpToPage.js I would say  
11:28 <+jvelociter> in resources/js/widgets/  
11:28 <+jvelociter> js/xwiki/widgets maybe  
11:31 <vmassol> jvelociter: I need to check ${request.contextPath}/rest/wikis/${context.database}/search?scope=name&number=10&media=json& right?  
11:32 <vmassol> I think that's where the result is coming from  
11:32 <vmassol> checking  
11:32 <+jvelociter> ah yes it's the REST api that should the filtering  
11:32 <+jvelociter> but AFAIK it does not  
11:32 <+jvelociter> maybe I'm wrong  
11:34 <vmassol> found it:  
11:34 <vmassol>             if (hasProgrammingRights) {  
11:34 <vmassol>                 f.format(") order by doc.fullName asc");  
11:34 <vmassol>             } else {  
11:34 <vmassol>                 f.format(") and doc.space<>'XWiki' and doc.space<>'Admin' and doc.space<>'Panels' and doc.name<>'WebPreferences' order by doc.fullName asc");  
11:34 <vmassol>             }  
11:34 <vmassol> ouch!  
11:34 <vmassol> hardcoded  
11:35 <+jvelociter> ouch  
11:35 <+jvelociter> :)  
11:35 <+jvelociter> vmassol: BTW I was thinking about this the other day, we currently don't a have way to get the list of blacklisted spaces from java code, right ?  
11:35 <vmassol> correct  
11:36 <vmassol> not without accessing the velocity context  
11:36 <vmassol> it should probably be the other way around… need to think abou it a bit  
11:38 <+jvelociter> yes I think blacklisted spaces should be in a configuration source and be provided to velocity via scripting services  
11:39 <+jvelociter> vmassol: this way we can even provide a UI in the administration to change the list  
11:39 <lucaa1> has quit  
11:39 <vmassol> yes was thinking about this too (making it a config property)  
11:39 <vmassol> (thus that can be overwritten in subwikis)  
11:39 <+jvelociter> yeo  
11:39 <+jvelociter> and another use case is adding more spaces  
11:39 <+jvelociter> when you import applications etc.  
11:44 <+tmortagne> would probably be easier to have a property in WebPreferences  
11:45 <vmassol> well we need a global value too  
11:45 <vmassol> webpref is only for a given space, I do'nt understand  
11:45 <vmassol> oh you mean  
11:45 <+tmortagne> you indicate for each space that it's a hidden space or something  
11:45 <+jvelociter> Thomas is saying each space should declare if it is blacjlisted or not  
11:45 <vmassol> I see  
11:46 <vmassol> yes  
11:46 <vmassol> sounds nicer  
11:46 <vmassol> would need some caches probably  
11:46 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:46 <vmassol> to not have to query all the time  
11:46 <+jvelociter> but it also mean we need to add WebPreferences to all spaces that should be BL  
11:46 <vmassol> in any case xwikipreferences and webprefs should be cached  
11:46 <vmassol> jvelociter: yes  
11:47 <vmassol> I don't think it's an issue  
11:48 <vmassol> ok… we need to help marius finish the release right now…. need to stay focused....  
11:48 <+jvelociter> oh, an elephant !  
11:48 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: that's not really an issue  
11:48 <+jvelociter> :)  
11:48 <jstoldt|Notebook> lol  
11:49 <+tmortagne> ok bad timing  
11:49 <+jvelociter> lol  
11:49 <+jvelociter> yes, that's not really an issue I agree  
11:49 <+tmortagne> but an elephant is definitely not an issue anyway  
11:49 <jstoldt|Notebook> i think it was superb timing  
11:49 <+jvelociter> we could use WebPreferences for other things too  
11:49 <+tmortagne> yes  
11:50 <+tmortagne> and big +1 for space pretty name  
11:50 <+jvelociter> yes we have to do that, also Denis raised some interesting questions regarding this  
11:50 <jstoldt|Notebook> come to think of it, vmassol, can you please check http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Syntax+Guide+Improvements#HImages  
11:50 <jstoldt|Notebook> and see if hte image specs meet your requirements?  
11:52 <vmassol> jstoldt|Notebook: cheecking (not sure I remember everything from the top of my head though)  
11:52 <jstoldt|Notebook> sure  
11:52 <vmassol> ah it's 2.0  
11:52 <vmassol> not 2.1  
11:53 <vmassol> protocol://path/name.end is overspecified  
11:54 <jstoldt|Notebook> too precise there?  
11:54 <vmassol> actually the code says:  
11:54 <vmassol>         if (rawReference.startsWith("http://") || !isInWikiMode()) {  
11:54 <vmassol>             type = ResourceType.URL;  
11:55 <vmassol>         } else {  
11:55 <vmassol>             type = ResourceType.ATTACHMENT;
